intro: Polystachya pseudodisa, commonly known as the false marsh orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is a terrestrial herb with a short rhizome and is native to southern Africa. The plant produces tall, slender stems with narrow, grass-like leaves. Its inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of pale green to yellowish flowers. Polystachya pseudodisa prefers moist, shaded environments and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
